title: Liberal spill 'changes nothing': Shorten
content:
Australians know that changing the leader of the Liberal Party changes nothing, Opposition Leader Bill Shorten says.

"Malcolm Turnbull is wrong when he says he is part of the solution," he told reporters in Canberra on Monday.

"Australia does not need another out of touch, arrogant, Liberal leader."

Mr Abbott has said he expects to win the ballot to be held in a special Liberal partyroom later on Monday night.

Mr Turnbull - who was ousted by Mr Abbott as Liberal leader in December 2009 - and deputy leader Julie Bishop met briefly with the prime minister after question time on Monday afternoon to tell him of the challenge.
